Name: Beyond TV
Notes:
Not compatible with DVB tuners.

While Snapstream is providing minor fixes for Beyond TV, they no longer actively updating and developing the software as they are focusing on commercial applications. Despite the lack of a new version, their fanbase (in the forums) maintains active and the program is still available.
See also: List of digital television deployments by country

Name: EyeTV
Notes: Bundled for no extra charge with all Elgato USB tuners, but also sold separately for use with other tuners.

Name: Hauppauge WinTV
Notes: Bundled for no extra charge, only works with Hauppauge TV cards and peripherals.

Name: InterVideo WinDVR
Latest stable release: Discontinued. Previously Bundled for no extra charge with various TV tuner devices.

Name: JRiver Media Center
Notes: DirectShow video player, audio, images, 10 foot GUI, Remote control, DLNA

Name: Kodi (formerly XBMC)
Notes: High quality cross-platform free and open source software PVR frontend application, able to watch/record live TV, music, photos and has one of the most expansive collection of plugins/addons, enabling the system to do anything from browsing the web or downloading movies, to dimming the lights in the sitting room.

Name: MediaPhoenix/ShowShifter
Notes: Supports some older TechnoTrend/Hauppauge boxes which are not BDA compliant, such as the Dec 2000-t/3000-s and first generation Nova-t USB boxes, which are unsupported by other PVR software.

Name: SageTV
Prices: Discontinued since it was bought by Google. Prior to that it had been $79.95 software; $29.95 client; $29.95 per mediaMVP client.
Notes: Java based. SageTV was purchased by Google on 20 June 2011 and its online store was shut.  No statement has been made about the future availability of SageTV products. Has been announced that SageTV will become opensource in 2015.

Name: Tvtime
Notes: High quality television application for use with video capture cards on Linux systems. tvtime processes the input from a capture card and displays it on a computer monitor or projector

Name: Video Disk Recorder (VDR)
Notes: TV Done Right, VDR can use one to eight video cards and support DVB-S, DVB-C and DVB-T. Record and read any DVB flux with a lot of plugins.

Name: Windows Media Center
Prices: Bundled for no extra charge prior to Windows 8 stable releases. US$100 for Windows 8 and 8.1 (respective Pro Pack, retail box pricing); US$10 for Windows 8 Pro and 8.1 Pro (Media Center Pack, online download).
Notes: Included in Windows XP MCE 2005, Windows Vista Home Premium and Ultimate editions, Windows 7 Home Premium, Professional, and Ultimate, and some Windows 8 preview/developer editions. Not included in Windows 8, 8 Pro, 8.1 or 8.1 Pro. Not available for Windows RT or Windows 10.

Name: VBox Home TV Gateway VBox@TV
Notes: Bundled for no extra charge with VBox Home TV Gateway - Network TV Tuner, Manage and schedule recordings from any web browser, local or over the internet
